page.title: 03Allotments, Thornton Road
page.content: {Pickering Smallholders and Allotments {Association}started in 1908 and today has 80 plots at an annual rent of Â£2.The recent increase is to pay for piped water. {Demand}for plots is high.12 names are on the waiting list,a number only once exceeded in the past.Many ladies have now joined. The Council,to whom rents are paid,are very helpful.An increase in the number of plots is not felt necessary as it is desirable to have a{waiting list}so that space is taken up as soon as it becomes available. Most gardeners have allotments either because they enjoy home-grown vegetables or because they have flower beds in their gardens at home and prefer to grow food elsewhere. Many are very enthusiastic and enter their produce in local shows.
